column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=So , would you classify yourself as a freelancer ?
#Text=I would say so , yeah .
#Text=And do you plan just working for a company , or would you like to carry on freelancing ?
#Text=I enjoy freelancing , because it gives me the freedom to work whenever I want , and do whatever projects I like .
#Text=And no one person is in-charge of me , and that 's really fun .
#Text=What does a normal day at work look for you ?
#Text=I wake up .
#Text=I have coffee .
#Text=I write all day , until I ca n't write anymore .
#Text=Then I have more coffee .
#Text=Then I read until I ca n't read anymore .
#Text=And then I fall asleep .
#Text=Seven days in the week .
#Text=That 's my life .
#Text=Sometimes I escape to ComicCons like this .
#Text=What are the changes in the comic book industry that you have noticed ?
#Text=I 've noticed that a lot of diverse voices are becoming more prominent recently .

#Text=And I think that 's , it 's because I think in society in general , diverse voices from different cultures , different backgrounds , different sort of sects and preferences and whatnot are becoming a lot more prominent in general .
#Text=And with comics being on the edge , the fringe medium , that tends to accumulate whatever is coming , a lot quicker than say film or other mediums .
#Text=So I think that new voices is one big thing , one big part of comics .
#Text=And also , diversification of how it is published .
#Text=So now it 's not just comics in comics stores , you 've also got bookstores , you 've got online , you 've got digital , you 've got web-comics like I told you , that I did .
#Text=So there 's a lot more avenues for people to get involved , make their own comics , [ ... ] .
#Text=I mean , ComicCon India is an exact example of the growing comic market .
#Text=Who was your favourite super-hero ?
#Text=My favourite super-hero is actually a super-villain .
#Text=Doctor Doom .
#Text=Because he is just the biggest badass ever .
#Text=He 's inspired so many villains .
#Text=He inspired Darth Vader .
#Text=The guy is just the coolest character ever .
#Text=So I have not had a chance to write him yet , but if I do , I have got a few stories up my sleeve .
#Text=Do you have some head-cannons regarding that and you will write fan-fiction about it ?
#Text=I do n't write fan-fiction , but I do have a few ideas in my head for how [ Doctor ] Doom could play .
#Text=Could you brief me about the process from , how an idea comes , and goes to the publication , and it is in the hands of any reader ?
#Text=You mean like , how does it go from being an idea in my head to a comic in someone 's hand ?

#Text=Okay ; well , typically , I will come up with an idea and you do n't know where you get your ideas from , they appear out of the blue , just jump into your brain , and if they stay around for a while , you ca n't get rid of them just by ignoring them , that means you have to write them .
#Text=So what happens usually is I will write on a one-page sheet , of what the comics is about , what my idea for the story would be .

#Text=And then I find an artist who likes that idea , and I team with them , and I write the script , and the artists will take the scripts off me and draw it , and I will say , " Okay , first page , I want a picture of this , picture of this , this dialogue , and this dialogue . "
#Text=And then , once we have created the first issue , we 'll send that to a publisher , they will proof[read ] it , check the spelling mistakes , there 's not many of them .
#Text=And what they do it to print it and send it out to stores .
#Text=So that would be the " short-and-sweet " way it works .
